member.name: IBaseFilter.EnumPins

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The EnumPins method enumerates the pins on this filter.

member.param: Address of a variable that receives a pointer to the interface.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IBaseFilter.FindPin

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The FindPin method retrieves the pin with the specified identifier.

member.param: Pointer to a constant wide-character string that identifies the pin. Call the method to retrieve a pin's identifier.
Address of a variable that receives a pointer to the pin's interface. If the method fails, *ppPin is set to NULL.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

listheader.description: Could not find a pin with this identifier.

member.name: IBaseFilter.JoinFilterGraph

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The JoinFilterGraph method notifies the filter that it has joined or left the filter graph.

member.param: Pointer to the Filter Graph Manager's interface, or NULL if the filter is leaving the graph.
Pointer to a wide-character string that specifies a name for the filter.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or an HRESULT value indicating the cause of the error.

The QueryFilterInfo method retrieves information about the filter.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.param: Address of a variable that receives a pointer to a wide-character string containing the vendor information.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

member.name: IBaseFilter.GetState

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetState method retrieves the filter's state (running, stopped, or paused).

member.param: Time-out interval, in milliseconds. To block indefinitely, use the value INFINITE.
Receives a member of the enumerated type, indicating the filter's state.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The filter is active, but cannot deliver data.

The Pause method pauses the filter.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those shown in the following table.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The IBaseFilter interface is the primary interface for DirectShow filters. All DirectShow filters must expose this interface. The Filter Graph Manager uses this interface to control filters. Applications can use this interface to enumerate pins and query for filter information, but should not use it to change the state of a filter. Instead, use the interface on the Filter Graph Manager.
Filter developers: Implement this interface on every DirectShow filter. The CBaseFilter base class implements this interface.
